intro: Lophochloa obtusiflora var. amblyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowering spikes. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
